Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory741.jpg'}
{3: 'Luna and the forest fall silent as one.'}
{3: 'Alpha calls out her name, only to notice that the frame made of the Red Tide is showing signs of decay, like a deteriorating human body.'}
{3: 'You direct Lamia to control the Punishing Virus in her body, allowing Liv to examine the slumbering figure.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Her M.I.N.D. is in complete chaos, and it's not even fully intact.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "The missing parts are mixed with corrupted data, it's as if...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Like when you were using the Empyrea frame?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Liv hesitates for a moment before giving a nod.'}

{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Back then, Liv's M.I.N.D. was torn apart by corruption. A M.I.N.D. connection couldn't restore it—we couldn't even establish one... No matter how much we called out to her, there was no response.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Even an agent will be torn apart by Punishing once they lose control over it...', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'α', 3: 'Liv is standing here safe and sound now—what did you do back then?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lucia pauses, only opening her mouth to speak after making sure she can continue.'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "I dove into the depths of Liv's M.I.N.D. and helped Commandant reestablish a remote connection. Once we stabilized Liv, we took her back for treatment.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Should we... take Luna to Babylonia?', 4: '2'}
{3: "Alpha's brow furrows, the scars of Project Winter still etched fresh in her mind."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Roland', 3: 'Everything else is negotiable. Whatever help you need, I can provide it. Alpha or I can do the deep dive instead.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'A M.I.N.D. connection with two Ascendants at once would only result in my complete corruption.', 3: '36'}
{2: 'The good news is, I had already prepared for a Deep M.I.N.D. connection with Luna before she entered the Red Tide.', 3: '37'}
{2: '...All I need to do is restart the connection.', 3: '38'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Roland', 3: "But you haven't done that yet. Something holding you back?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'When establishing a Deep M.I.N.D. connection with the Empyrea frame, Commandant almost fell victim to the corrupted data...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "And it's an Ascendant now.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Both sides fall into silence.'}
{3: 'The mermaid musters her courage and takes a step forward.'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'The corrupted data mainly comes from the Punishing Virus, which can be controlled by Ascendants.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'I... will help. I\'ll temporarily put the Punishing Virus eroding Miss Luna into a "stagnant" state to buy you some time.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'You can perform such precise operations?', 4: '1'}
{3: "According to the file, most Ascendants in Luna's faction use the Punishing Virus as their primary means of attack."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lamia', 3: 'I... only learned how to do this recently.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'From other Ascendants?', 3: '58', 4: 'Vonnegut?', 5: '58'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "That's impossible...", 4: '2'}
{2: "Don't tell me the Ascension-Network taught you this?", 3: '60'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "That's more or less how it works.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: 'A-anyway, you can trust me on this.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "Miss Luna's frame continues to decay. Soon, she will return to the Red Tide...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lamia', 3: "I think it's because she still can't fully control this frame... not that she could in her current state, anyway.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'What she experienced in the Red Tide, how she managed to force her way out, and how she seized that fleeting moment to counterattack—all of this remains unknown.'}
{3: "After a moment's thought, you give Gray Raven a nod."}
{2: 'If anything goes wrong, just cut my Deep M.I.N.D. connection quickly.', 3: '71'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Leave it to us, Commandant.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Under everyone's watchful eyes, you approach Luna once again."}
{3: 'You take a deep breath, centering your focus, prepared to reestablish the M.I.N.D. connection.'}

{3: 'At the edge of your vision, a figure flickers in and out of view, wandering through the maze...'}
